data.title: great barbecue
data.text: I was so glad when they revamped their restaurant, it is much better than before.  I have been very pleased with the new food selections and the stuffed baked potato is as awesome as ever.  their prices can't be beat either.

data.title: Lunch favorites
data.text: As often as I can I run in for a quick take out lunch. BBQ is always tasty along with the most friendly staff. This is a Mesquite must do.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: The BBQ HERE is hit and miss . Sometimes it is the best ever sometimes it is trash . I do not know if it is just the quality of the meat or smoking technique.. It is never the same . Excellent sauce and friendly service during the day .. Always go back but always a gamble

data.title: Pretty Good BBQ. Excellent Staff
data.text: I wish I had gotten the name of the guy at the door of the 8 Second Club at the Mesquite BBQ because he was fantastic. The kind of attitude, energy, professionalism & friendliness that would be an asset to any company. The bartenders were terrific too. I am a southern guy so I have a southern flair for BBQ and couldn't wait to try Texas BBQ and their brisket. It was good..not mind blowing but it was good. They had little cheesy enchilada things that were great...could've used more sides on buffet but everything was certainly tasty.

data.title: Good BBQ
data.text: This is a good place for BBQ.  You can order your food to eat there or to take out.  The restaurant had been remodeled recently and is more cozy than it used to be.  Good place for lunch or dinner .

data.title: DOWN, Down, down
data.text: This was a revisit and no improvement. The meat is OK but they should concentrate on having goo bar-b-cue rather than having an extensive menu. But the real problem is turning the place over to teenagers in the evening. They are a prime example of why the minimum wage should not be increased. Playing first, customers second. What a shame!

data.title: Best BBQ Around
data.text: There is no place in Mesquite that makes better BBQ than Mesquite BBQ.  The meat of any kind is always juicy. The BBQ sauce tastes like the meat. The sides are few but good.  The only negatives are: 1. No drivethrough, but you can park three feet from the door sometimes. 2. The building is small, greasy, rundown, very basic, terrible ladies' restroom--but we love it. At lunch and anytime Saturday there may not be a seat in the house, but dinners to go are very efficient.

data.title: Delicious BBQ
data.text: Let me just say, I travel for a living. Never have I ever experienced a friendlier staff to take your bbq order with a smile. The food is delicious, and it's even great to take home with you. The location is perfect, right in old downtown Mesquite!

data.title: Best bbq in town
data.text: This is the best bbq in town. Yes It is a little whole in the wall but best bbq by far in the area. We always get the chopped beef sandwich plate and it's big enough to share.

data.title: Great Texas Barbeque
data.text: I live in Memphis and am not easily impressed by Barbeque restaurants.  However this location can hold its own with anything in Memphis.  Been in business since 1959, the place is not fancy, but is darn good, priced right and Texas sized portions.

data.title: Consistently great
data.text: Been going to Mesquite BBQ for a while.  It's just great.  Their food is always good, and served hot.  They have gone through a lot of help, but with each new worker they get, we still see their determination to be a great BBQ joint.

data.title: Mediocre
data.text: My Husband and I Went for Lunch. Had The Bbq Sandwich. Not impressed. There are way better places in Mesquite. Atmosphere was not good. Old and Run Down. Could barely finish eating because I couldn't eat staring a Deer in the Eyes!  A Very old place been here forever. Will not go back. Husband had to try it. Told him No!! He was not pleased.

data.title: Bad B-B-Q in Mesquite.
data.text: Really not good B-B-Q, just sort of Bland, as were all the sides. They had the same old over cooked under seasoned sides. That was the good side, cleanliness and service are not something this place has heard of. Dead roach on floor should I say more!

data.title: Best BBQ in Mesquite!
data.text: Forget all the BBQ chains! Mesquite BBQ, right downtown catty-corner from Mesquite HS (State Champs in 2001), is a family-owned and operated kind place. They have the best brisket in town, bar none. Their Manhandler sandwich will remind you why you need a big truck...that is if you can roll your stuffed belly back into the driver's seat! It is a bit out of the way for those who hang around Town East Mall, but it's worth the drive to get some great BBQ.

data.title: Ok Food, Good Prices, Service Needs Help
data.text: On a not very busy night, their service was terrible. While the food is above average and the prices are fair. I had the sandwich plate with fries and beans. Looked good and seemed hot. Until I stood in line for al is trend minutes waiting on a very slow cashier who had trouble working the CC machine. And then glad to record the transaction on a paper form. Just too many teens working the night shift. Meat was good, fries were OK and beans were tasty. Just go for lunch not dinner.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Visited last night after not being there for several months. They have remodeled and it looks very nice. The meat was melt in your mouth delicious and their fries are hand cut. Like all BBQ, it is expensive but get the sandwich, fries and drink water and you can get out of there for $7.95+tx.

data.title: Local BBQ Favorite
data.text: When I travel I do prefer to try to eat local as much as possible.  This more than met my BBQ fix with big portions and tasty sides.  The potato casserole seems to be the most popular side and I was glad I tried that.  I also tried the brisket and pulled pork, both were delicious and served with a smile.

data.title: Not that good.
data.text: Small. Lunch type place. Not that good. Cannot Eat while Looking a Deer in the Eye!!!  Will Not Be Going Back!

data.title: Best Around!
data.text: Family run business.  Very good food.  I usually get the baked potato stuffed with sliced beef or the Manhandler Basket with sliced beef and sausage.  The meats are tender and flavorful and the sauce is sweet with a little kick.

data.title: Good prices, average food
data.text: Great pricing, average food. I was expecting better from a BBQ restaurant in Mesquite, Texas. The food was nothing that would entice me to return. The only thing that stood out was the chocolate chip cookies. Otherwise the food could use a little spicing up and creativity. I can't recommend this place.
